definition[0]: to leave to go to another place
definition[1]: to prevent something from happening, especially something bad
example[1]: The president intervened to head off the conflict.
definition[2]: to stop someone going somewhere by moving in front of them
example[2]: Soldiers headed them off at the border.
definition[3]: to take action to prevent something bad from happening
example[3]: The country needs to find oil in time to head off a serious energy crisis.
